question: How to appeal your Virginia's Insurance Marketplace Eligibility
text:
How to appeal your Virginia's Insurance Marketplace Eligibility
          
        
(Desplazarse hacia abajo para ver Preguntas Ms Frecuentes en Espaol)
"Appeal Rights and Instructions","Consumer Appeal Request Form (English)"," Consumer Appeal Request Form (en Espaol)","What Are Your Rights? ","You have the right to appeal any final eligibility determination made by Virginias Insurance Marketplace (the Marketplace) that relates to:","Your eligibility to buy health coverage through Virginias Insurance Marketplace","The amount of Advanced Premium Tax Credits you are eligible to receive","The amount of Cost Sharing Reductions you are eligible to receive","Your eligibility for a Special Enrollment Period","Your eligibility for Medicaid or FAMIS*","*Appeals of Medicaid and FAMIS eligibility decisions may only be appealed to the Virginia Department of Medical Assistance Services (DMAS). Please see the Appeals of Medicaid and FAMIS Eligibility section below for instructions regarding Medicaid and FAMIS appeals.","Many actions taken by the Marketplace are not final eligibility determinations  and therefore  cannot be appealed.  ","Please note: Any change in your eligibility for benefits may also change the eligibility of other people in your household.","If you are unsure whether your issue may be appealed to the Marketplace  contact Marketplace Customer Service."," "
"Timeframe to Request an Appeal","You must submit your appeal within 90 days from the date of the eligibility determination notice you wish to appeal.","Appeals of Medicaid and FAMIS eligibility must be submitted to DMAS 35 days from the date of the eligibility determination notice you wish to appeal.","Please note: If you have an immediate need for health services and a delay could seriously jeopardize your health  you can ask for an expedited (faster) appeal review."," "
"Timeframe to Request an Appeal","You must submit your appeal within 90 days from the date of the eligibility determination notice you wish to appeal.","Appeals of Medicaid and FAMIS eligibility must be submitted to DMAS 35 days from the date of the eligibility determination notice you wish to appeal.","Please note: If you have an immediate need for health services and a delay could seriously jeopardize your health  you can ask for an expedited (faster) appeal review."," "
"How to Submit an Appeal","You can submit your appeal online through your Marketplace account  by mail  or by phone.","Your appeal must include your name  address  and the detailed reason why you believe your eligibility determination is in error. If you are requesting an appeal for someone else (like your child)  also include their name.","You can locate the Consumer Appeal Request Form by going to https://help.marketplace.virginia.gov and selecting How to appeal in the upper right corner of the page."," ","Then  follow the directions below for filling out and submitting the Appeal Request Form. ","Any decision about your eligibility for benefits may also change the eligibility of other people in your household.","Online: Fill out the form  electronically sign the form  and save the form as a PDF. If you wish to include any supporting documentation with your appeal  you may combine the documentation with your Appeal Request Form PDF or upload it separately. Next  go to enroll.marketplace.virginia.gov  log into your account  and click My Tickets on your dashboard. Choose Submit New Ticket to create a ticket and then upload your appeal PDF to the ticket."," ","Mail: Fill out the form  then print and sign the form. Mail your signed Appeal Request Form  along with copies (keep your originals) of any supporting documentation to:","Virginias Insurance Marketplace","Document Processing","ATTN: APPEALS","PO Box 428","Birmingham  AL 35201"," ","Phone: Call the Marketplace Customer Service at (888) 687-1501. Marketplace Customer Service representatives cannot provide legal advice  but they can answer questions about filing appeals and even assist with completing an Appeal Request Form.","What Happens Next?","After you submit your Appeal Request Form  the Marketplace will contact you to let you know whether we have everything we need to process your appeal. Once we have everything required  we will review your appeal and notify you of our decision  along with any next steps.","Informal Review A representative from the Marketplace will contact you to attempt to resolve your appeal. If you do not agree with the outcome of the informal review  you may request to escalate your appeal to a formal hearing instead. Most consumer appeals are resolved to the consumers satisfaction through the informal review.","Formal Hearing If you choose not to participate in the informal review process or are unable to resolve your appeal during that phase  a representative will contact you to schedule your appeal hearing and will confirm the date and time of your hearing in a written Notice.","Withdrawal of an appeal","You may cancel or end your appeal any time before the hearing officer issues a decision  this is known as a withdrawal of an appeal.","Representation during an appeal","You have the right to have a representative  including a lawyer  help you with your appeal. The Marketplace will not provide a lawyer for you. Your representative is a trusted person you choose who has your permission to discuss your appeal with the Marketplace  see your information  and act for you on matters related to your appeal  such as signing your Appeal Request or making arguments on your behalf at the hearing.","If you want to have a representative participate in your appeal  you must either designate that person on your Appeal Request Form or submit a request to designate a representative in a separate document.","Get Help","If you need help filing an appeal or have additional questions about the appeal process  contact Marketplace Customer Service at (888) 687-1501. Marketplace Customer Service representatives cannot provide legal advice  but they can answer questions about filing appeals and even assist with completing an Appeal Request form. If you need help with your appeal in a language other than English  please contact (888) 687-1501 and select 5 for Spanish or 8 for other languages.","Appeals of Medicaid and FAMIS Eligibility","In addition to the Marketplace appeals process above  you can appeal a Medicaid or FAMIS eligibility decision to the Department of Medical Assistance Services (DMAS).","Ways to ask for a Medicaid appeal with DMAS.","Electronically. Online at https://www.dmas.virginia.gov/appeals or email to appeals@dmas.virginia.gov","By fax. Fax your appeal request to DMAS at (804) 452-5454","By mail or in person. Send or bring your appeal request to Appeals Division  Department of Medical Assistance Services  600 E. Broad Street  Richmond  VA 23219","By phone. Call DMAS at (804) 371-8488 (TTY: 1-800-828-1120)","To help you  a Medicaid Appeal Request Form is available from DMAS at https://www.dmas.virginia.gov/appeals/.","You can also write your own letter. Include a full copy of your eligibility determination notice when you file your appeal. Also include any documents you would like DMAS to review during the appeal.","Your deadline to ask for a Medicaid appeal with DMAS is 90 days from notice date.  Once you ask for an appeal  DMAS will schedule a hearing if you qualify for one. You may also request someone to represent you at any point during the appeals process  with notice to DMAS about your decision in writing. If you have any questions about Medicaid appeals  call the Appeals Division of DMAS at (804) 371-8488 (TTY: 1-800-828-1120)  or visit https://www.dmas.virginia.gov/appeals/applicant-member-appeals-resources/ for more information. ","To learn more about getting free legal advice or to ask for someone to represent you in your appeal case  call the free Legal Aid Helpline at 1-866-534-5243 or visit www.valegalaid.org."

"Derechos de apelacin e instrucciones para presentar una apelacin"
"Cules son sus derechos?","Usted tiene derecho a apelar cualquier determinacin final de elegibilidad realizada por el Mercado de Seguros de Virginia (el Mercado) relacionada con lo siguiente:","Su elegibilidad para adquirir una cobertura mdica a travs del Mercado de Seguros de Virginia.","La cantidad de crditos fiscales anticipados de prima que es elegible para recibir.","La cantidad de reducciones de costos compartidos que es elegible para recibir.","Su elegibilidad para un perodo de inscripcin especial.","Su elegibilidad para Medicaid o FAMIS*."," ","*Las apelaciones de decisiones sobre elegibilidad de Medicaid y FAMIS solo pueden ser apeladas ante el Departamento de Servicios de Asistencia Mdica de Virginia (Department of Medical Assistance Services  DMAS). Consulte la seccin Apelaciones de elegibilidad para Medicaid y FAMIS a continuacin para obtener instrucciones sobre apelaciones de Medicaid y FAMIS.","Muchas medidas tomadas por el Mercado no son determinaciones finales de elegibilidad y  por lo tanto  no se pueden apelar. ","Tenga en cuenta lo siguiente: Cualquier cambio en su elegibilidad para acceder a los beneficios tambin puede cambiar la elegibilidad de otras personas de su hogar.","Si no sabe si su problema se puede apelar ante el Mercado  comunquese con el Servicio de Atencin al Cliente del Mercado."
"Cul es el plazo para solicitar una apelacin?","Debe presentar su apelacin dentro de los 90 das a partir de la fecha del aviso de determinacin de elegibilidad que quiere apelar.","Las apelaciones de elegibilidad de Medicaid y FAMIS deben enviarse a DMAS dentro de los 35 das a partir de la fecha del aviso de determinacin de elegibilidad al que quiere apelar.","Tenga en cuenta lo siguiente: Si tiene una necesidad inmediata para acceder a servicios de salud y un retraso podra representar un grave peligro para su salud  puede solicitar una revisin acelerada (ms rpida) de la apelacin."
"Cmo presentar una apelacin?","Puede enviar su apelacin en lnea a travs de su cuenta de Mercado  por correo o por telfono. ","La apelacin debe incluir su nombre  su direccin y el motivo detallado por el que considera que su determinacin de elegibilidad es errnea. Si solicita una apelacin para otra persona (por ejemplo  su hijo)  incluya tambin su nombre.","Puede encontrar el Formulario de solicitud de apelacin del consumidor al visitar https://help.marketplace.virginia.gov y seleccionar Cmo apelar en la esquina superior derecha de la pgina. ","Luego  siga las indicaciones para completar y enviar el Formulario de solicitud de apelacin.","Cualquier decisin sobre su elegibilidad para acceder a los beneficios tambin puede cambiar la elegibilidad de otras personas de su hogar.","En lnea: complete el formulario  frmelo electrnicamente y gurdelo como un archivo PDF. Si desea incluir documentacin de respaldo junto con su apelacin  puede combinar la documentacin con el PDF del Formulario de solicitud de apelacin o cargarlos por separado. Luego  dirjase a enroll.marketplace.virginia.gov  inicie sesin en su cuenta y haga clic en Mis comprobantes en el panel. Elija Enviar nuevo comprobante para crear un comprobante y luego  cargue el PDF de su apelacin all.","Correo postal: complete el formulario  luego imprmalo y frmelo. Enve por correo postal el Formulario de solicitud de apelacin firmado  junto con copias (debe conservar los originales) de la documentacin de respaldo a: ","Virginias Insurance Marketplace ","Document Processing","ATTN: APPEALS","PO Box 428 ","Birmingham  AL 35201","Telfono:","llame al Servicio de Atencin al Cliente del Mercado al (888) 687-1501. Los representantes del Servicio de Atencin al Cliente del Mercado no pueden proporcionar asesoramiento legal  pero pueden responder preguntas sobre cmo presentar apelaciones e incluso ayudarle a completar un Formulario de solicitud de apelacin.","Qu sucede despus?","Despus de enviar su Formulario de solicitud de apelacin  el Mercado se comunicar con usted para informarle si tenemos todo lo que necesitamos para procesar la apelacin. Una vez que todo est completo  revisaremos su apelacin y le notificaremos sobre nuestra decisin  junto con los prximos pasos. ","Revisin informal Un representante del Mercado se comunicar con usted para intentar resolver su apelacin. Si usted no est de acuerdo con el resultado de la revisin informal  puede solicitar que la apelacin se derive a una audiencia formal. La mayora de las apelaciones de los consumidores son resueltas para la satisfaccin del consumidor a travs de una revisin informal. ","Audiencia formal Si decide no participar en el proceso de revisin informal o no puede resolver su apelacin en esa etapa  un representante se comunicar con usted para programar la audiencia de apelacin y le confirmar la fecha y la hora de su audiencia en un Aviso por escrito. ","Retiro de una apelacin","Puede cancelar o finalizar su apelacin en cualquier momento antes de que el funcionario de audiencias emita una decisin. Esto se conoce como retiro de una apelacin. ","Representacin durante una apelacin","Usted tiene derecho a tener un representante  incluido un abogado  para que lo ayude con su apelacin. El Mercado no le proporcionar un abogado. Su representante es una persona de confianza que usted elige y a la que le otorga permiso para tratar su apelacin con el Mercado  ver su informacin y actuar en su nombre en asuntos relacionados con dicha apelacin  como por ejemplo  firmar la Solicitud de apelacin o presentar argumentos en su nombre en la audiencia.","Si desea que un representante participe en su apelacin  debe designarlo en el Formulario de solicitud de apelacin o presentar una solicitud para designar a un representante en un documento por separado. ","Obtenga ayuda","Si necesita ayuda para presentar una apelacin o tiene ms preguntas sobre el proceso de apelacin  comunquese con Servicio de Atencin al Cliente del Mercado al (888) 687-1501. Los representantes del Servicio de Atencin al Cliente del Mercado no pueden proporcionar asesoramiento legal  pero pueden responder preguntas sobre cmo presentar apelaciones e incluso ayudarle a completar un formulario de Solicitud de apelacin. Si necesita ayuda con su apelacin en un idioma distinto al ingls  llame al (888) 687-1501 y marque 5 para espaol u 8 para otros idiomas.","Apelaciones de elegibilidad para Medicaid y FAMIS","Las apelaciones de todas las decisiones sobre elegibilidad de Medicaid y FAMIS deben ser escuchadas por el Departamento de Servicios de Asistencia Mdica (DMAS).","Formas de solicitar una apelacin de Medicaid ante el DMAS:","Electrnicamente. En lnea en https://www.dmas.virginia.gov/appeals o al enviar un correo electrnico a appeals@dmas.virginia.gov.","Por fax. Enve su solicitud de apelacin por fax al DMAS al (804) 452-5454.","Por correo postal o en persona. Enve o lleve su solicitud de apelacin a Appeals Division  Department of Medical Assistance Services  600 E. Broad Street  Richmond  VA 23219","Por telfono. Llame al DMAS al (804) 371-8488 (TTY: 1-800-828-1120).","Para ayudarlo  est disponible un Formulario de solicitud de apelacin de Medicaid en el DMAS en https://www.dmas.virginia.gov/appeals/.","Tambin puede escribir su propia carta. Al presentar su apelacin  incluya una copia completa de su aviso de determinacin de elegibilidad. Tambin incluya cualquier documento que desee que el DMAS revise durante la apelacin.","Su fecha lmite para solicitar una apelacin de Medicaid ante el DMAS es de 35 das a partir de la fecha de notificacin.  Una vez que haya solicitado una apelacin  el DMAS programar una audiencia si califica para una. Tambin le puede pedir a alguien que lo represente en cualquier momento durante el proceso de apelacin  con aviso al DMAS de su decisin por escrito. Si tiene alguna pregunta sobre las apelaciones a Medicaid  llame a la Divisin de Apelaciones del DMAS al (804) 371-8488 (TTY: 1-800-828-1120)  o visite https://www.dmas.virginia.gov/appeals/applicant-member-appeals-resources/ para obtener ms informacin. ","Para obtener ms informacin sobre cmo obtener asesoramiento legal gratuito o pedir que alguien lo represente en su caso de apelacin  llame a la Lnea de asesoramiento legal gratuito al 1-866-534-5243 o visite www.valegalaid.org."
